QuoteText: Descartes attempts exactly that, have you read that meditations thing the whole way through too? I thought I was the only one. Pretty awful after the classic part, but it was as good an attempt at proving god from first principles as any.
ResponseText: Not cover to cover, but Descartes failure demonstrates the futility of that particular exercise. All I'm looking for here is a logical sequence to "therefore the universe exists" which can be done. I want to know if the creationists are capable of sticking to logic the whole way through without making the illogical jumps which we see so often.
